thread.title: Taylor Swift speaks out on marriage rumors
thread.title_full: Taylor Swift speaks out on marriage rumors - CBS News

author: Antoinette Bueno ET Online
title: Taylor Swift speaks out on marriage rumors
text:
Don't expect any wedding bells to ring anytime soon for Taylor Swift and Calvin Harris .
The 25-year-old "Wildest Dreams" singer took to Twitter on Tuesday to slam recent rumors that she's planning a wedding to the 31-year-old Scottish DJ/producer, and that she bought a mansion in Beverly Hills, California.
"What the press says I'm doing: Buying a Bev Hills mansion, getting married in an English castle. What I'm doing: Playing a show in St. Louis," Swift tweeted.
Watch: This grandma absolutely freaked out when Taylor Swift welcomed Mick Jagger to the stage
What the press says I'm doing: Buying a Bev Hills mansion, getting married in an English castle What I'm doing: Playing a show in St. Louis
— Taylor Swift (@taylorswift13) September 29, 2015 Tabloids recently reported that Harris was spotted shopping for engagement rings in Beverly Hills, and that the two were going to wed in a $2 million English ceremony. Meanwhile, it was reported on Tuesday that Swift allegedly paid $25 million for the Samuel Goldwyn estate in Beverly Hills.
This isn't the first time, of course, that Swift has taken to Twitter to debunk reports. Last month, she denied buying a castle in Scotland.
"Cause baby I could build a castle out of all the bricks they threw at me" -a line from New Romantics But I'm not actually buying a castle.
— Taylor Swift (@taylorswift13) August 11, 2015 Harris himself talked about all the false rumors surrounding the couple in July, but noted that it was a small price to pay for being with his superstar gal.
"It's interesting because obviously there's different things written about it every day and even if we don't do anything publicly for a while, someone will make something up," Harris told UK radio station KIIS FM . "For me it could be a lot worse, and I'd still be, like, insanely happy with her so I'm good with it."
